poem:
**A Stalemate of Iron**

Barred hearts in crowded cells,
stone walls taller than our will.
Promises and blame traded
like the morning mist.
Legacies of rust,
where wings cannot spread—
sound and fury in an echoing void,
laying bricks of despair
instead of hope.
They build no new dawn,
only the silence of chains.
